column1: This painful injury is also called a "pulled muscle."

To help your hamstring muscle heal, you may need: - A knee splint for a short period of time - Crutches if you cannot put any weight on your leg - A special bandage wrapped around your thigh (compression bandage) Symptoms, such as pain and soreness, may last: - 2 to 5 days for a grade 1 injury - Up to a few weeks or a month for grade 2 or 3 injuries If the injury is very close to the buttock or knee or there is a lot of bruising: - It may mean the hamstring was pulled off the bone.
- Compression -- A compression bandage or wrap can reduce swelling and ease pain.
For pain, you can use ibuprofen (Advil, Motrin), naproxen (Aleve, Naprosyn), or acetaminophen (Tylenol).
- Talk with your doctor before using these medicines if you have heart disease, high blood pressure, kidney disease, or have had stomach ulcers or internal bleeding in the past.
Slowly increase your physical activity, such as walking.
